required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Growth and Safety of Two Partially-hydrolyzed Feeding Systems for Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Growth and Safety of Two Partially-hydrolyzed Feeding Systems for Preterm Infants: a Multi-centered, Open-label Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label trial consisting of two sub-studies to be conducted sequentially with the purpose of evaluating the safety and suitability of a two feeding systems in pre-term infants (one containing HMOs and one without HMOs).

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multi-center, open-label trial to be conducted in up to 70 pre-term infants in order to evaluate the safety and suitability of two feeding systems as they would typically be used in the neonatal care unit. Growth (in comparison to recommended growth goals), feeding tolerance, biochemical parameters, and adverse event reporting will be evaluated.
The two feeding systems will be tested in two sub-studies to be conducted sequentially: sub-study 1 will evaluate a two-staged feeding system with HMOs in up to 35 pre-term infants; sub-study 2 will evaluate a two-staged feeding system without HMOs in up to 35 pre-term infants.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From FEF Day 1 to when infant reaches 1800 g (on average between 4 to 6 weeks after birth) or hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth), whichever comes earlier

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Pre-FEF Day 1 to FEF Day 1, and then weekly from FEF Day 1 until hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth) and at 30- and 60-days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in weight gain (g/day and g/kg/day)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Pre-FEF Day 1 to hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth) and at 30- and 60-days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Change in length (cm/week)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Pre-FEF Day 1 to hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth) and at 30- and 60-days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Change in head circumference (cm/week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Anthropometric z-scores for weight, length and head circumference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Pre-FEF Day 1 to hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth) and at 30- and 60-days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Corresponding z-scores and changes in z-scores expressed using Fenton growth chart will be analyzed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline + weekly over 3 consecutive days starting on pre-FEF Day1 + weekly over 3 consecutive days starting on FEF Day1 until Neonatal Unit Discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth)
secondary_outcome.description: Neonatal unit feeding questionnaire capturing timing, type, rate and amount of feeding (parenteral & enteral), gastric residual volumes, number of missed feedings

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly between FEF Day 1 and hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth)
secondary_outcome.description: Stool frequency (range from 0-20 times a day) collected via neonatal unit questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly between FEF Day 1 and hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth)
secondary_outcome.description: Stool consistency (watery, mushy soft, runny, formed, hard) collected via neonatal unit questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly between FEF Day 1 and hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth)
secondary_outcome.description: Bloody stools (yes or no) collected via neonatal unit questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly between FEF Day 1 and hospital discharge (on average 7 weeks after birth)
secondary_outcome.description: GI symptoms (incidence of abdominal distention, regurgitation, spitting and vomiting) collected via neonatal unit questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 consecutive days just prior to the 30-day PD and 60-day PD visits
secondary_outcome.description: Parent-reported 3-Day Intake Diary capturing the total number of bottles of formula and approximate volumes consumed per day

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 consecutive days just prior to the 30-day PD and 60-day PD visits
secondary_outcome.description: Stool frequency captured via parent-reported 3-Day Intake Diary

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 consecutive days just prior to the 30-day PD and 60-day PD visits
secondary_outcome.description: Stool frequency captured via parent-reported 3-Day Intake Diary

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 consecutive days just prior to the 30-day PD and 60-day PD visits
secondary_outcome.description: GI symptoms (such as presence of stomach ballooning, bloody stools, regurgitation, spitting-up and vomiting) captured via parent-reported 3-Day Intake Diary

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 consecutive days just prior to the 30-day PD and 60-day PD visits
secondary_outcome.description: GI-related behaviors (such as crying and sleep quality) captured via parent-reported 3-Day Intake Diary

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline (if possible), pre-FEF Day 1, then weekly pre-FEF Days 7, 14, etc. and FEF Day 1, then weekly on FEF Days 7, 14, 21, until Neonatal Unit Discharge, and at 60 days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Serum albumin and blood urea nitrogen (BUN)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline (if possible), pre-FEF Day 1, then weekly pre-FEF Days 7, 14, etc. and FEF Day 1, then weekly on FEF Days 7, 14, 21, until Neonatal Unit Discharge, and at 60 days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Serum P, alkaline phosphatase, calcium and creatinine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline (if possible), pre-FEF Day 1, then weekly pre-FEF Days 7, 14, etc. and FEF Day 1, then weekly on FEF Days 7, 14, 21, until Neonatal Unit Discharge, and at 60 days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary Ca, P and creatinine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: FEF Day 1, Neonatal Unit Discharge and at 60 days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Vitamin D

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, FEF Day 1, then weekly on FEF Days 7, 14, 21, until Neonatal Unit Discharge, at 30 day-PD and 60 days PD
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal microbiota composition, diversity and metabolism markers (SCFAs)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fecal markers for gut health / maturation and immune status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (if feasible), FEF Day 1, Day 21, Neonatal Unit Discharge, 30 day-PD and 60 day-PD
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal levels of calprotectin, alpha 1 antitrypsin, pancreatic elastase (i.e. chymotrypsin-like elastase family, member 3B (CELA3B)), Human beta-defensin 2 (HBD2) and secretory IgA

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine markers for gut health / maturation and immune status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (if feasible), FEF Day 1, Day 21, Neonatal Unit Discharge, 30 day-PD and 60 day-PD
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary level (spot urine sample) of intestinal fatty acid binding protein (iFABP)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time the mother has consented to the infant's participation in the study until the 60 days PD visit
secondary_outcome.description: Number of AEs through investigator-confirmed AE reporting

intervention.description: Preterm infants will receive Stage 1 formula as soon as possible after birth until when 1.8 kg of body weight is achieved. Preterm infants will receive Stage 2 preterm formula from when 1.8 kg of body weight is achieved until 2 months after hospital discharge.

Preterm infants will receive Stage 1 formula as soon as possible after birth until when 1.8 kg of body weight is achieved. Preterm infants will receive Stage 2 preterm formula from when 1.8 kg of body weight is achieved until 2 months after hospital discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Written informed consent has been obtained from one or both parent(s) /legally acceptable representative (LAR) in accordance with local regulation.
2. Infants' birth weight ≤1500 g and AGA.
3. Infant's gestational age ≥ 27 weeks and ≤ 32 weeks.
4. Infant is clinically stable and does not have deteriorating respiratory function after birth.
5. Infant is eligible to start experimental formula after 24 hours of trophic feeding, but still within the first 10 days (≤240 hours) of life.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Parent(s) not willing / not able to comply with the requirements of study protocol.
2. Infant is experiencing early onset sepsis.
3. Major congenital or chromosomal abnormality known to affect growth.
4. Liver failure.
5. Peri-/intra-ventricular haemorrhage (grade 3-4 in Papille classification).
6. Infant who has siblings with diagnosed allergies or intolerances to lactose or cow's milk.
7. Infant's participation in another interventional clinical trial.
8. Infant has already achieved FEF prior to enrolment, using the definition accepted by Neonatal Unit as per standard practice (150 mL/kg/day).

facility.name: Klinika Chorob Dzieci, Uniwersytecki Szpital Dzieciecy
Fakultna nemocnica s poliklinikou Nove Zamky
